description: This week is National Pollinator Week which is celebrated all across the country to raise awareness for pollinators and their importance to the ecosystem. NAP is participating in National Pollinator Week by hosting a workday in the Native Garden at Furstenberg Nature Area. Join us on Saturday, June 25th from 9:00am-Noon at Furstenberg Nature Area to help the local pollinators by removing invasive plants from within the Native Garden. For more information on the workday with NAP please visit www.a2gov.org/napevents and for more information on National Pollinator Week visit www.pollinator.org/pollinatorweek .
name: National Pollinator Week

description:
Arbor Brewing Company presents...
ACOUSTIC TUESDAYS!
Every Tuesday at 7pm, we’ll be featuring live acoustic sets from the area’s most talented artists.

-June 21 Joel Parkkila

Joel Parkkila, from the Ann Arbor punk rock and roll band Human Skull, will play acoustic folk and rock.

Never a cover
Always a good time
name: Acoustic Tuesdays: Joel Parkkila

description:
Summer is here; come celebrate the longest day of the year with us! Whether you’re a page poet, slammer, performance artist or refuse a label, we want to hear your new stuff on our open mic. We look forward to sharing great poetry (and great coffee) with you and invite you to join this free open mic and monthly reading series!


Sign up! 7:00 p.m.

7:15 p.m. – Open mic
8:00 p.m. – Featured Reader

This month's feature: JOSH DAVIS!

Joshua Davis holds MFAs from the University of Southern Maine and the University of Mississippi. He has recent or forthcoming poems in The Midwest Quarterly, The Rotary Dial, Monster Verse: Poems Human and Inhuman (Everyman's Library, 2015), and The Cabildo Quarterly. He lives and writes in Athens, Ohio, where he's a Ph.D. candidate in American Literature. 


Next month's feature: ANN ARBOR YOUTH POETRY SLAM TEAM!
name: Skazat! Poetry Series featuring Josh Davis

description:
Restaurant Week is your opportunity to try as many great Ann Arbor restaurants as your schedule allows for one incredibly low fixed price. $28 for a three course dinner! 

The Main Street Area Association (Main Street Area Ann Arbor) is proud to bring you Ann Arbor's favorite semi-annual dining event - Restaurant Week!
The specials run June 12-17th. Visit www.annarborrestaurantweek.com for details.
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week

description:
We are gearing up for another week of culinary bliss during Ann Arbor's summer Restaurant Week! 

We are featuring these special menus available in addition to our regular menu all week long.  
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Summer Restaurant Week 2016
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Two for $15 lunch
Tax and gratuity not included
•	Choose one entrée for each person
o	BBQ Tofu Sandwich
o	Whitefish Po-boy
o	Chicken BLT
o	Caesar Salad
o	Cherry Almond Salad
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Two for $28 dinner per person
Tax and gratuity not included

Appetizer
To share, please choose one
•	Fried Pickle Spears 
•	Truffle Sprouts
•	Hummus and Pita 

Entree
Each guest chooses one entree
•	Mac and Cheese
•	Fish and Chips
•	Urban Cowboy Bean Burger
•	Ar-burger

Dessert or Beer
To share, please choose one
•	Stout Chocolate pudding cake
•	Strawberries and Cream Belgian waffle
•	Maple Bourbon Bread Pudding

Not interested in dessert? Swap it out for your choice of two 16oz drafts
name: Restaurant Week

description:
Our June Artists' Meet & Greet topic is Tips on Applying for Grants: Specifically MCACA Minigrants. Join us for this free event, connect with other artists and the Art Center staff.

Speaker: Allison Buck

You will learn about:

- Tips for submitting a compelling application.
- What types of opportunities are fundable?
- How to create an accurate budget.
- Things to pay extra attention to in order to avoid application mistakes.
- Other resources for grant opportunities:
- Grant Station 
- The Arts Alliance Newsletter

Our monthly Artists' Meet & Greets, held at the 117 Gallery, are a perfect opportunity to connect with the Art Center, network with other artists and attend artist talks by guest speakers.

Learn more about our Artists' Meet & Greet Events: www.annarborartcenter.org/artists-meet-greet/
name: Tips on Applying for Grants

description: Thursdays through Sundays through June 26. Check out Tickets Available link for arb member advance ticket info plus note Summer 2016 construction impacting arboretum area parking & traffic. Arrive early for tickets and time to walk to location of the first scene.
name: Shakespeare in the Arb 2016 Love's Labour's Lost Week 2

description:
Journalist Amy Haimerl and her husband had been priced out of their Brooklyn neighborhood. Seeing this as a great opportunity to start over again, they decide to cash in their savings and buy an abandoned house for $35,000 in Detroit, the largest city in the United States to declare bankruptcy.

As she and her husband restore the 1914 Georgian Revival, a stately brick house with no plumbing, no heat, and no electricity, Amy finds a community of Detroiters who, like herself, aren t afraid of a little hard work or things that are a little rough around the edges. Filled with amusing and touching anecdotes about navigating a real-estate market that is rife with scams, finding a contractor who is a lover of C.S. Lewis and willing to quote him liberally, and neighbors who either get teary-eyed at the sight of newcomers or urge Amy and her husband to get out while they can, Amy writes evocatively about the charms and challenges of finding her footing in a city whose future is in question. Detroit Hustle is a memoir that is both a meditation on what it takes to make a house a home, and a love letter to a much-derided city.
name: Amy Haimerl: Detroit Hustle

description:
Yo! Its been a great  run and we'd like to give a big shout out to Greg Powell and the rest of the staff at Club Above, and especially to all you who have been comin out to support over the last year!!! 


Lookin to end our residency with a bang and show some love to the people, so this will be a FREE show!! 

Stay tuned, Northern Threat has plenty up its sleeves for the near future  :) Its just time for us to start partying on the weekends like the rest of the working world haha
